intro: Aegiphila oleifera, commonly known as the Brazilian tea tree, is a shrub native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is known for its essential oils, which are extracted from its leaves and used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. Aegiphila oleifera plays an important role in local ecosystems and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
